column2: Token Localization
Token Localization
Token Localization
Token Localization
Option: Enable Crisis from the Start

In HPM, crisis only start after 1870 and after Revolution and Counter-revolution is researched and an event fires. This is to stop stuff like free Ireland in 1840 because of the militancy that the famine generates, among other weird crisis. Selecting this option will remove these restrictions and make crisis happen from the start of the game, like it happens in Vanilla Victoria 2.
Launch Raids against the French invaders

The loss of our entire coastline to the French imperialists has left our country broken, both economically and militarily. But while the French have superior arms, they lack our intimate knowledge of our land's geography. By launching raids into the French occupation, we can cripple their operations in our lands and perhaps drive them back across the sea.
Raise the UltraIndia Question

With the Prussian threat to our borders defanged for now, India divided, and the Ming on the brink of collapse, we now have a perfect opportunity to finally focus the brunt of our attention to the rich lands of the Orient we've long considered secondary to our interests in Europe. Of particular interest to our merchants in the Bengal region are the Kalian highlands, home to scores of mountain tribes keen on raiding our coastal concessions, vast forests of valuable teakwood, and the key to permanently securing our position in the Far East. However, while there's no doubt we'll be able to bring Kale to heel on their own, the Kingdom of Kale is still technically a tributary of the Ming Empire and, though weakened as they are, it's doubtful that the Chinese will simply abandon their tributaries while their right to rule is under growing scrutiny. Our minister have been warned that another long, protracted war with the Ming in the Kalian jungles and mountains could prove ruinous for our frail economy. Demanding Ming withdrawal would simplify matters considerably but, should they refuse, we shall have to prepare for the worst.
Raise Regional Armies

500 years of our peoples' history, all the thousands of years of imperial Chinese history has culminated in this singular struggle the west calls 'The Taiping Revolution.' This is a struggle for the fate of China. As such, we cannot afford to lose here. Whatever the price, whatever the means, we must win.
The Hainan Treaty Port

The city of Zhuya (Shore of Pearls), name for the famous pearl fisheries of the region, now known as Qiongshan is an important stop to Shanghai and Formosa. Controlling it would give control over all of Hainan and would make an important coaling station.
The Taiwan Concession

The Taipei area is where the major Han Chinese settlements in northern Taiwan and one of the designated overseas trade ports, Tamsui, are located. The area gained economic importance due to the booming overseas trade, especially that of tea export. Controlling it would mean controlling Taiwan and a good amount of the tea trade.
The Jiaxing Treaty Port

Jiaxing is well known as the 'hometown of silk' and it's a famous producer of textiles and woolens. While not being as important as neighboring Shanghai, its acquisition would surely help our textile industry.
The Weihaiwei Treaty Port

The port of Weihaiwei serves as the base for the Beiyang Fleet (Northern Seas Fleet) for the Qing Dynasty. Along with Lüshun, it provides a strategic point for the control of the Korea Bay and the Bohai Gulf. Controlling it would put our fleets at the door of the imperial capital of China.
The Lüshun Treaty Port

Sprawling around the narrowest neck of the Liaodong Peninsula, occupying the Southern Tip, Lüshun, also known as Port Arthur, is in a crucial point. It guards the entrance the Imperial Capital of China and the Bohai Sea. Controlling it would provide a strategical hold on the Bohai Gulf and the Korean Bay.
The Qingdao Treaty Port

Qingdao is a sleepy fishing town undergoing dramatic changes - a naval station and garrisons were built by the rulers of the Qing dynasty and the increasing presence of western ships is increasing its importance. It would be an splendid gateway to northern China.
The Shanghai Treaty Port

For centuries a major administrative, shipping, and trading town, Shanghai grew in importance in the 19th century due to European recognition of its favorable port location and economic potential. This potential can be fully realized under $COUNTRY_ADJ$ administration.
The Hong Kong Treaty Port

China is the main supplier of its native tea to Europe, whose annual domestic consumption reached 30,046,935 pounds (13,629,060 kg) in 1830, an average of 1.036 pounds (0.470 kg) per head of population. From the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ economic standpoint, Chinese tea was a crucial item since it provides massive wealth for the taipans — foreign (especially $COUNTRY_ADJ$) businessmen in China — while the duty on tea accounted for 10% of the government's income. With a base in Hong Kong our tea and opium trade will profit immensely and the city will, without a doubt, bring us a lot of profit.
The Macao Treaty Port
Macao lies on the western side of the Pearl River Delta across from Hong Kong. If we are to access the riches of Guangdong and the south of China, controlling Macao would be a good start.
The Ningbo Treaty Port

Ningbo is one of China's oldest cities, with a history dating to the Hemudu culture in 4800 BC. Ningbo was known as a trade city on the silk road at least two thousand years ago, and then as a major port, along with Yangzhou and Guangzhou in the Tang Dynasty, thereafter, the major ports for foreign trade in the Song Dynasty. A walled city sandwiched between the ocean and low-lying mountains to the southwest, with coastal plain and valleys in between, it plays an important role in controlling the important peninsulas of Chuanshan and Xiangshan Peninsula. During the Ming and Qing Dynasties, the textile industry flourished in Ningbo.
The Cheju Island Concession

The Cheju (or Jeju) island, south of Korea, lies in the Korea Strait between Japan and Korea. According to the local legend, three demigods emerged from Samsung which is said to have been on the northern slopes of Mt. Halla and became the progenitors of the Jeju people who founded the Kingdom of Tamna. During the Joseon Dynasty of Korea Jeju islanders were treated as foreigners and Jeju was considered as a place for horse breeding and exile for political prisoners. In the 17th Century, Injo of Joseon issued an edict prohibiting islanders from traveling to the Korean mainland. Despite the poverty, the Island would serve as a good base to exert influence over Korea and Japan and it's the place that's more likely to be ceded - the current owners don't care about it too much.
The Chongsheng Island Concession

Chongsheng Island is the largest of the Liuqiu Islands and the heart of one of the prime trade routes between China, UltraIndia, and the Japanese Isles. Aside from the mercantile influence control of the island would afford us, Chongsheng's proximity to the major nations of the Far East would allow us sufficient naval range to supply future endeavours in the region.
The Zanzibar Island Concession

Zanzibar, coming from zangi, a Persian name of a local people, said to mean "black," and the Persian bar, which means coast or shore. The Zanzibar Archipelago consists of several islands lying off the coast of East Africa in the Indian Ocean. There are three main islands plus a number of smaller islets that surround them and an isolated tiny islet. Zanzibar is the center of the Arab slave trade and projects its power over a long strip of land in Eastern Africa. It would serve as an excellent base of operations and coaling station in East Africa.
The Socotra Island Concession

A small archipelago of four islands in the Indian Ocean, Socotra has been inhabited since the 1st-century AD, appearing as Dioskouridou ("of the Dioscuri") in the Periplus of the Erythraean Sea, a Greek navigation aid. The main city of the island is called Hadibu and with a garrison, a fort and a port, the island would be an ideal place for a coaling station for our ships coming and going from India and Eastern Africa.
Rename Theopylae

Theopylae was Constantinople
Now it's Theopylae, not Constantinople
Been a long time gone,
Oh Constantinople
Who do we have to thank?
Well, no one but the Franks.
Reform the Rus

Centuries divided between the accursed nomads of the east and the treacherous Germanics in the west have all led up to this. Centuries of languishing under foreign occupation, centuries of fighting to preserve our culture and our legacy have given us the strength to bring our brethren together under the greatest Slavic empire in the East of the last thousand years. With our people reunified at last, it's finally time to throw off the Tatar yoke and reform the Rus!
Unify Lech, Czech, and Rus

In the distant past, the three Slav brothers - Lech, Czech, and Rus - parted ways to found their respective nations. And what a mistake that was. Divided, we Slavs have been subject to all manner of foreign depredation without the strength to fight back - or even to protect ourselves. But even those hardships may have been a blessing in diguise, for our struggles for independence against the Nords and the Tatars have brought us camaraderie with our likewise suffering, likewise struggling brethren in the west. We stand now poised to correct our forebearers' mistake and reunify the Slavs under one Slavic banner, one Slavic nation to retake our homelands for the sake of all Slavs - past, present, and still yet to come!
Unite the Western Slavs

Despite all our past conflicts, we Poles, Czechs, and Slovaks are not all that dissimilar: we are all blessed peoples with rich culture stuck in hard times as of late, we have been strong enough to stand the twin tests of time and foreign occupation, and - above all - we are Slavic brothers long estranged. But no longer. With each other at our sides, let us stand shoulder to shoulder against the world's depredations with all the Slavic courage that has let us endure this long. Let us make a toast and bring an end to our unjust divorce, Pan. Here's to Ceska, here's to Polska, here's to Slovensko, and here's to our futures united!
Smithianism

Laissez-faire philosophies, such as minimizing the role of government intervention and taxation in the free markets, and the idea that an "invisible hand" guides supply and demand are among the key ideas Adam Smith's writing is responsible for promoting. Our trade policies are largely inspired by him.
Orthodox Liberal School

The Orthodox school of economic thought, also known as the French Liberal School or Oprtimist School, voraciously defends free trade and laissez-faire capitalism. They are the primary opponents of collectivist, interventionist and protectionist ideas.  Our trade policies are largely inspired by this school.
No Set Trade Policy
Our government doesn't have a set trade policy and prefers to make snap decisions on tariffs.
Mercantilism

Mercantilism is a type of policy designed to maximize the trade of a nation and especially to maximize the accumulation of gold and silver. It promotes governmental regulation of a nation's economy for the purpose of augmenting state power at the expense of rival national powers.
Economic Nationalism

The aim of this policy is to have a country that is economically independent and nationally self-sufficient. It favors policies that emphasize domestic control of the economy, labor, and capital formation, even if this requires the heavy imposition of tariffs and other restrictions on the movement of labor, goods and capital.
Choose a Trade Policy

While the ruling party has its own broad trade policy, there are several schools of economic thought competing competing for space in the government. Adopting a trade policy will take away some of the flexibility in setting tariffs, but it will allow for more efficient tariff collection and possibly other benefits over what a volatile tariff police might have. 


§YNOTE: Researching Market Regulations will unlock more options when this decision is taken. You can disable this decision entirely and for the rest of the game by taking it and choosing the last option in the fired event.§W
AI: Rescind Trade Policy
Our trade policy, or our neighbor's, no longer correspond to the ruling party wishes.
Revive the old Norse ways

At our height, the word 'Viking' would strike fear in the hearts of men as far as Jerusalem and fill our halls with great hordes of gold. Yet, despite all our efforts and our meteoric rise to the global stage, our people have not been able to inspire the same fear and awe that our raiding and pillaging forefathers did in the rest of Europe. King Christian VII has plans to summon back the old Viking spirit and make our great empire the scourge of the North once again.
Reunify Japan

A thousand years of disunity. Of internal strife, of weakening our people for the sake of ephemeral glories. Such petty squabbles of petty lords have fractured our islands and allowed outsiders to plant their flags and armies on our fields, our castles, our homes while we have lived thus, divided and weak, cowed and submissive, trembling like children during a long, dark night. But no longer. For the night is over and a new day is dawning, a new era where the Japanese Islands stand strong and independent, united under our banners. Under this new sun and led by the Chrysanthemum throne, we will once again command our own destiny!
Liquidate the Crown of Espange

Our strangehold of the Iberian peninsula has ensured security to the south for decades. However, growing Iberian nationalism and threats to other directions are making our hold over Espange untenable. We could continue to linger in the Iberian quagmire and hope for the best or sell the crown to Portugal, both to remove ourselves from the situation and hopefully reconcile our two nations for the time being.
Embrace the Gyushuans

The nine provinces of the island of Gyushu exist in limbo. Too Japanese for their Korean overlords, too Korean for their Japanese brethren across the strait, Gyushuans eke out a decent, yet marginal exsitence between two ancient cultures, desired by both but accepted by neither. As such, their loyalty is questionable and could easily be swayed to either side, given satisfactory concessions. Certainly, centuries of Korean rule have made Gyushu an integral part of our realm and its people our citizens in all but name. Shall we formalise our ancient bond and bring Gyushu fully into our nation?
Embrace the Gyushuans

The nine provinces of the island of Gyushu have never known what they are in the grand geopolitical balance of power. Too Japanese for their Korean overlords, too Korean for their Japanese brethren across the strait, Gyushuans eke out a decent, yet marginal exsitence between two ancient cultures. As such, their loyalty is questionable and could easily be swayed to either side, given a satisfactory concession. While Gyushuans share an uncomfortable amount of similarities with their former masters across the strait, at heart they are our brethren. Let us take them by the hand and led them into a brighter future with the rest of the Japanese people!
Embrace the Kirishitans

Kirishitans may worship a strange, foreign god but they are still our brethren. We cannot afford to fight our brothers when outsiders seek to wipe us from history, not again. Let us extend our hand to the Kirishitans and fight as one, as we should have from the beginning.
Dispute our Dominican border
Our borders with our Dominican neighbor are loose and ill-defined. With a strong enough show of force, and our overlord's consent, we can solidify them to our advantage.
Dispute our Dominican border
Our borders with our Yankee neighbor are loose and ill-defined. With a strong enough show of force, and our overlord's consent, we can solidify them to our advantage.
Claim Massachusetts
Massachusetts has long been divided between us and the Dominicans. Let us settle the border once and for all by seizing the rest of the region for ourselves.
Claim Massachusetts
Massachusetts has long been divided between us and the Yankees. Let us settle the border once and for all by seizing the rest of the region for ourselves.
Claim New York
New York has long been divided between us and the Dominicans. Let us settle the border once and for all by seizing the rest of the region for ourselves.
Claim New York
New York has long been divided between us and the Yankees. Let us settle the border once and for all by seizing the rest of the region for ourselves.
Claim Virginia
Virginia has long been divided between us and the Dominicans. Let us settle the border once and for all by seizing the rest of the region for ourselves.
Claim Virginia
Virginia has long been divided between us and the Yankees. Let us settle the border once and for all by seizing the rest of the region for ourselves.

North Carolina has long been divided between us and the Dominicans. Let us settle the border once and for all by seizing the rest of the region for ourselves.
Claim North Carolina
North Carolina has long been divided between us and the Yankees. Let us settle the border once and for all by seizing the rest of the region for ourselves.
Claim Georgia
Georgia has long been divided between us and the Yankees. Let us settle the border once and for all by seizing the rest of the region for ourselves.
Claim Kentucky
Kentucky has long been divided between us and the Yankees. Let us settle the border once and for all by seizing the rest of the region for ourselves.

Georgia has long been divided between us and the Dominicans. Let us settle the border once and for all by seizing the rest of the region for ourselves.

Kentucky has long been divided between us and the Dominicans. Let us settle the border once and for all by seizing the rest of the region for ourselves.
Reclaim Imperial provinces
Recent turmoil and weak central authority forced us to cede certain regions to our regional governors. Now that we've gotten back on our feet, it's time to reassert direct control over our empire.
